alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 12:41PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Nicholas and east central Fayette Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Babcock State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Nicholas and east central Fayette Counties. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 21 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas
